comment: I'm really glad I took this class with this professor. I expected only introductory-level content, but he went above and beyond by assigning us a development project that was extremely helpful for learning.

I learned more about agile software development in this class than in all my other classes combined. Software engineering should be hands-on, not just theory and that's exactly what this class delivers. Highly recommended.

The professor did an amazing job by giving us a real project. Honestly, this project opened my eyes and helped me better understand the world of software engineering, and for that, I am truly grateful.

Everyone who answered the schedule link said available Thursday, so we met Thursdays. Most skipped and did zero coding. Group project/presentation was 60% of the grade. Prerecorded videos so low/no interaction with the professor. No peer evaluation at the end to report being used for a free grade. Not writing an email to make myself a target.

Great lectures online.  Very relaxed and open to questions and discussion.  Encourages participation and is comfortable with interruptions.  Keeps on track to finish the lecture, but sometimes ends off early (or goes over a minute or two) if he's done/not-done with what he had planned to cover.  Very easy to understand.  Very knowledgeable.

If you want a professor to just sit back, read slides and assign 3 semester projects you have the perfect professor. He loves assigning projects so that he can just sit back and do nothing all semester long. This course was Emerging Software Processes and he assigns discussions, assignments, a semester long development project, and a research paper

The class was just a big project where you and a group create software. So it relies a lot of your group working together. All most of the grade comes from that project. Some discussions and only one test which was open note.
He is super funny and knowledgable. The project was brought by him from industry, which was so cool to work on.
Had a great learning experience in his class. It was also fun and engaging!
